meanings.definition: A person who performs magic tricks or illusions.
meanings.sent1: The children were amazed by the conjurers at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The conjurers at the circus wowed the audience with their tricks.
meanings.sent3: The conjurers made a coin disappear, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a conjurer's spell, captivating the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The conjurers' performance was so mesmerizing that no one could look away.

meanings.definition: A person who calls upon or uses supernatural powers.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of ancient conjurers who could control the elements.
meanings.sent2: The village feared the conjurers who were said to have dark powers.
meanings.sent3: The conjurers were rumored to have summoned a ghost in the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: The conjurers' eyes glowed with an otherworldly light as they chanted.
meanings.sent5: The conjurers' presence sent shivers down everyone's spines, as if magic was real.

meanings.sent1: The young conjurers were eager to learn new tricks from the master magician.
meanings.sent2: In the world of entertainment, conjurers are always exploring new ways to amaze.
meanings.sent3: The group of conjurers met every week to share their latest illusions.
meanings.sent4: His hands moved with the precision of a skilled conjurer, never revealing the secret.
meanings.sent5: The conjurers' dedication to their craft was evident in every flawless performance.
